Welcome

Quick Example

>>> from prody import *
>>> pdb = parsePDB('1p38')
>>> ca = pdb.select('calpha')
>>> anm = ANM('p38_MAPK')
>>> anm.buildHessian(ca)
>>> anm.calcModes(6)
>>> writeNMD('p38_anm.nmd', anm, ca)
Reads a p38 PDB structure, selects alpha carbons, and performs ANM calculations. Slowest 6 modes are written in NMD format for visualization using NMWiz and VMD.

ProDy is a free and open-source Python package for analyzing protein structural dynamics. It allows for quantitative analysis of heterogeneous experimental structural datasets and comparison with theoretically predicted conformational dynamics. It is designed and developed by Ahmet Bakan in Bahar lab at the University of Pittsburgh.

What is the input to ProDy?
The input to ProDy functions and classes is the set of atomic coordinates of the query protein in PDB file format, or simply the PDB id or the sequence of the protein. Fast and flexible ProDy parsers are used to retrieve the corresponding dataset of PDB files from the PDB FTP server and extract their coordinate data and other relevant information.

What is the output?
ProDy outputs dominant patterns in structural variability extracted by principal component analysis (PCA) of the experimental datasets and normal modes describing the intrinsic dynamics of proteins predicted by normal mode analysis (NMA) based on elastic network models (ENMs).

To learn more about ProDy you may start from the Tutorial, or from one of the following examples:

  • Examination and analysis of structural variability observed in experiments:
    • Fast and flexible parsing of PDB files
    • Powerful atom selections and contact identification
    • Matching, superposing, and comparing multiple structures/chains
    • Principal component analysis (PCA) of X-ray structures
    • PCA of NMR models and mixed structural datasets from Blast search
  • Prediction and analysis of protein dynamics using theory and simulation:
    • Normal Mode Analysis using the Anisotropic network model (ANM)
    • Gaussian network model (GNM) analysis
    • Essential dynamics analysis (EDA) of MD snapshots
    • Comparative analysis and visualization of dynamics

For a list of features with links to examples see Feature Index.

Featured Publication

  • The intrinsic dynamics of enzymes plays a dominant role in determining the structural changes induced upon inhibitor binding
    Bakan A, Bahar I. 2009 Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A 106(34):14349-14354.
  • See all in Publications.
